Articles.Content:
Supersonic transport.

Max speed: 1100 m/s at 13 km, maybe more.

It can land at 50 m/s.

It can maneuver like a fighter jet.

It can transport 2 full orange tanks (72 tons) (do you even need to transport that?).

It can have pics:

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/sIpD0)

Download:

[Dropboxy!](https://www.dropbox.com/s/qhtv1wh2f9nycsu/Supersonic%20Transport.craft?dl=0)

Thanks for reading.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-02T14:36:36Z" title="05/02/2015 02:36  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 2, 2015</time> by gmpd2000**

> 
> Download:
> 
> Soon! (this is a WIP)
> 
> Thanks for reading.

 How soon? looks pretty useful for transport missions on Kerbin.

> 
> How soon? looks pretty useful for transport missions on Kerbin.

I'll guess today or tomorrow.

> 
> supersonic transport.
> It can have pics:

oh my god!!!!

No opinions?

Come on, try this craft!

This does make me a little sad in 1 way... I've been unable to get a MK3 craft to fly at speeds over 500m/s @ altitudes over 10km... My big bomber can only hold 270m/s @ 12,200m. How? Why? Can I "borrow" some of your technology? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Nice job on the transport plane though. Looks pretty smooth.

> 
> This does make me a little sad in 1 way... I've been unable to get a MK3 craft to fly at speeds over 500m/s @ altitudes over 10km... My big bomber can only hold 270m/s @ 12,200m. How? Why? Can I "borrow" some of your technology? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
> Nice job on the transport plane though. Looks pretty smooth.

Turbojets are the answer. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
